body: @karimagnusson What's the full stack trace of the error?

### Stack trace for FileAlreadyExistsException:

! @7511lhil7 - Internal server error, for (POST) [/video/resumable/upload/j64y8tnk?resumableChunkNumber=52&resumableChunkSize=1048576&resumableCurrentChunkSize=1048576&resumableTotalSize=72968045&resumableType=video%2Fmp4&resumableIdentifier=72968045-f8fa54595d404450a487ce1f08012574m4v&resumableFilename=f8fa54595d404450a487ce1f08012574.m4v&resumableRelativePath=f8fa54595d404450a487ce1f08012574.m4v&resumableTotalChunks=69] ->
 
play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$$anon$1: Execution exception[[FileAlreadyExistsException: /var/folders/1t/cwyz6701029fmqwqyy4_200r0000gn/T/playtemp4016054458618813336]]

Caused by: java.nio.file.FileAlreadyExistsException: /var/folders/1t/cwyz6701029fmqwqyy4_200r0000gn/T/playtemp4016054458618813336
	at sun.nio.fs.UnixException.translateToIOException(UnixException.java:88)
	at sun.nio.fs.UnixException.rethrowAsIOException(UnixException.java:102)

play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$$anon$1: Execution exception[[DirectoryNotEmptyException: /var/folders/1t/cwyz6701029fmqwqyy4_200r0000gn/T/playtemp5242047326278202622]]
	at play.api.http.HttpErrorHandlerExceptions$.throwableToUsefulException(HttpErrorHandler.scala:255)
	at play.api.http.DefaultHttpErrorHandler.onServerError(HttpErrorHandler.scala:180)
	at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer$$anonfun$13$$anonfun$apply$1.applyOrElse(AkkaHttpServer.scala:252)
	at play.core.server.AkkaHttpServer$$anonfun$13$$anonfun$apply$1.applyOrElse(AkkaHttpServer.scala:251)

Caused by: java.nio.file.DirectoryNotEmptyException: /var/folders/1t/cwyz6701029fmqwqyy4_200r0000gn/T/playtemp5242047326278202622
	at sun.nio.fs.UnixFileSystemProvider.implDelete(UnixFileSystemProvider.java:242)
	at sun.nio.fs.AbstractFileSystemProvider.deleteIfExists(AbstractFileSystemProvider.java:108)
	at java.nio.file.Files.deleteIfExists(Files.java:1165)
	at play.api.libs.Files$DefaultTemporaryFileCreator.play$api$libs$Files$DefaultTemporaryFileCreator$$playTempFolder(Files.scala:181)
	at play.api.libs.Files$DefaultTemporaryFileCreator.create(Files.scala:163)
	at play.core.parsers.Multipart$$anonfun$handleFilePartAsTemporaryFile$1.apply(Multipart.scala:121)
	at play.core.parsers.Multipart$$anonfun$handleFilePartAsTemporaryFile$1.apply(Multipart.scala:119)
	at play.core.parsers.Multipart$$anonfun$multipartParser$1$$anonfun$6.apply(Multipart.scala:79)
	at play.core.parsers.Multipart$$anonfun$multipartParser$1$$anonfun$6.apply(Multipart.scala:77)
	at akka.stream.impl.fusing.MapAsync$$anon$23.onPush(Ops.scala:1172)

Thank you, @karimagnusson. I can see that both methods where the exceptions are originating have a clear documentation that they can fail. [`Files.createDirectories` documentation says](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/nio/file/Files.html#createDirectories-java.nio.file.Path-java.nio.file.attribute.FileAttribute...-):

> FileAlreadyExistsException - if dir exists but is **not a directory** (optional specific exception)

While this is pretty unusual, that is something that we need to handle. But it would be good if you can create an example project to reproduce this problem because, as you can see in the docs, the exception is thrown when the path **is not a directory**. I couldn't find a situation where we are creating a file (or symlink) instead of a directory.

Is this just using the regular file upload?

The second exception is something we need to fix without a doubt as it is documented in [`Files.deleteIfExists`](https://docs.oracle.com/javase/8/docs/api/java/nio/file/Files.html#deleteIfExists-java.nio.file.Path-):

> **Throws:**
DirectoryNotEmptyException - if the file is a directory and could not otherwise be deleted because the directory is not empty (optional specific exception)

I'm working in a fix for that.

Just to be clearer, my main concern about `FileAlreadyExistsException` is that if we are somehow creating a file instead of a directory, we will eventually move the problem to somewhere else. That is why I consider that would be good to have a reproducer here.

issue.title: Avoid to create multiple temporary folders

repository.name: playframework
repository.description: The Community Maintained High Velocity Web Framework For Java and Scala.

body:
Hi @karimagnusson, a few more questions for you: :)
- how often does this happen? how many concurrent requests are you running?
- do you have a simple project or code that we can use to reproduce this exception?
- any chance there's a symlink in this path? (https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8130464)

Hi, thanks for a quick response.

In my project I am using [resumablejs](http://www.resumablejs.com/) to upload large files in chunks. By default there are 3 chunks uploaded concurrently. When I upload a file of 70MB I get one or two errors most of the time.

I could not find any symlinks in the JVM temporary folder where the play temp folders are.

I created a simple demo to reproduce the error.
[upload-demo.zip](https://github.com/playframework/playframework/files/1214991/upload-demo.zip)
In application.conf you will have to set a path for the uploaded files.
`video.inbox = "/path/to/folder/"`
Then start the server and go to http://localhost:9000/assets/upload/index.html
There is no UI, just check the console.

If you do not get errors you can try to upload a larger file or change `simultaneousUploads` in index.html, line 47.
@karimagnusson, thanks a lot. We'll check that out.

@karimagnusson, see the current status of #7713.

Thank you so much for helping us to better identify the problem.

Hi @karimagnusson, we've just released Play 2.6.3 which should resolve this issue. If you get a chance, it would be great if you could test it out. :)

Thanks a lot for your help with reproducing the problem.
